subject: p19549821
History: Resolved DKA, now with persistent nausea and outside chest radiograph reportedly showing right lung opacity, here to evaluate for pulmonary consolidation or lesion.
Findings: The cardiac silhouette is normal in size. The mediastinal and hilar contours are within normal limits. The pulmonary vasculature is not engorged. The lungs are well expanded and well aerated without focal consolidation concerning for pneumonia. No pleural effusion or pneumothorax is detected. Mild biapical pleural thickening is symmetrical.
